title: Festive curly font
content:
Hi! Can you help me find this font. It has a curly end in letter "g" and "y". Hope you can help me with this one. Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [download.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/typophile.com/files/download.jpg) | 15.42 KB |
| [iba magmahal\_main.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/typophile.com/files/iba%20magmahal_main.jpg) | 9.27 KB |
author: nixxx30

comments.content:
These remind me of old Fontek/Letraset typefaces, but I’m finding no match.

There are enough subtle differences in repeating letters to lead me to believe these are calligraphy, not typefaces.

I edited to remove the distracting tropical disco effects, enhance clarity etc.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bawat@33_6438.jpg)
  
Makes it easier to focus on some substitutes for this lettering.  
Leaving aside the curly tails on \_g\_ and \_y\_ and the explosive dot on \_i\_, I seem to recall several marker pen type fonts that would be passable stand ins.  
Don

A few:  
Suzee FY [http://www.myfonts.com/search/suzee+fy/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/suzee+fy/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/suzee+fy/fonts/")  
Logotype Frenzy [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/decade-typefoundry/logotype-frenzy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/decade-typefoundry/logotype-frenzy/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/decade-typefoundry/logotype-frenzy/")  
Signalist [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mika-melvas/signalist/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mika-melvas/signalist/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mika-melvas/signalist/")  
Coco FY [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/coco-fy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/coco-fy/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/coco-fy/")  
Filmotype Lucky [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/lucky/")  
Don

As for the curly tails on \_g\_ and \_y\_ you could pick this up from a font like Fantini [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fantini/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fantini/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fantini/") or Griffy [http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Griffy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Griffy "http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Griffy") and [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/neapolitan/griffy-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120702/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/neapolitan/griffy-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/neapolitan/griffy-pro/")  
Don
